Seller's Notes: The big news for 1968 A-bodies was the Super Stock 426 Hemi package, available in the Dart and Barracuda; around 50 of the latter were produced. This was a drag race only package, featuring a race-tuned Hemi and a seriously lightened body with acid-dipped doors, Lexan in place of glass, factory delete of anything not essential to life on the drag strip (e.g. back seat, sound deadener, window cranks). They had a little sticker which indicated that the car was not for use on public highways, but for "supervised acceleration trials" only. Running into the low to mid 8 seconds these cars dominated the top NHRA Super Stock classes (SS/A and SS/AA). Super stock was not for everyone but for the people that were involved it was EVERYTHING. Ed Miller actually raced this particular B029 in 1968 and was the original owner of this car. The history alone behind this car is so significant to the Super Stock Heritage. Just being able to race side by side with Sox & Martin must have been a true honor. Just imagine going up against the Ford Drivers Don Nicholson or Hubert Platt or against Chevy Drivers like Dave Strictler or Bill Grumpy Jenkins but more importantly running up against legendary cars such as the Boss 429s, Mach Is or the COPO Camaros or the rare Yenkos. But theres something that Plymouth had that would send chills up the spines of Ford and Chevy racers.It was the HEMI !! And could this Hemi see the sky!! You are viewing a true 1968 Plymouth Barracuda Super Stock B029 car. Was born with the Hemi Engine from the factory and now its the SS/AA spec Hemi built by legendary Ray Barton. (approx. $40k-$60k+). Ray Barton was known for extracting over 900 horses out of his engines. Let me say it again this is a real B029 68 Plymouth Barracuda Super Stock Car. This particular Cuda has been a popular West Coast competitor and made its way up to North BC and over to us in the North East. And over the LRA Enterprises is your one stop shop for everything Automotive! We offer: 1st Inspection and Emmissions Fees Free Financing Call us today for a test drive!! 877-835-2161!!

Seller's Notes: 1970 Plymouth hemicuda 472ci Hemi engine, all new parts TREMEC 5 speed manual A/C, power steering and disc brakes Rotisserie restored and purple everywhere! LOADED with desirable options! Original Los Angeles-built car All receipts from build! Some cars are born stars. The right colors, the right engines, the right options. They're bought for big money and kept in vaults. We sell those, so we're not knocking them one bit--they're simply for a different purpose. This car wasn't one of the chosen: Sand Pebble Beige with black body protection strips, a 318 2bbl and shift on the column automatic, and a dark green bench seat interior...this was one ugly duckling! Just like in the story, though, this one became a beautiful swan, and it's got HEMI power to boot! Start outside where you're looking at a very clean color change to one of Mopar's best, In-Violet (or Plum Crazy for the Dodge folks,) code FC7. Of course, nothings going to grab your attention like that big hole in the hood. Sure, Ford put shakers on the Mustang, but only Chrysler would cut one big enough to double as an escape hatch for the engine! The hoods steel, too and not one of those flimsy fiberglass jobs. The grille up front has been masterfully restored and the road lights are excellent reproductions. Sliding down the sides youll find the brand new Hemi callout stripes on the massaged sides. New door handles, a new antenna and buffed and polished window trim enhance the very purple scheme from nose to tail. The bumpers sport excellent chrome, while the dual mirrors went body color. The Go-Wing on the trunk, excellent taillights, a refinished tail panel and dual chrome exhaust tips stick out of the `Cuda lower valance round out the rear view. New rallye wheels with BFGoodrich Radial T/As (235/60 front and 255/60/15 rear) tires finish off what would have been a dream order sheet! Inside, youll spend your time sitting on restored black buckets--theyre the most visible part R&H Collectibles is a private collection of fine automobiles including classic, muscle, custom hot rods and sports cars. All of our vehicles are kept in an secure, indoor, climate controlled facility. They are checked and maintained regularly to ensure they are in top condition. This collection inventory is constantly changing. Please contact us for an appointment and private showing.

Seller's Notes: Call 888-740-1824 or email sales@mcgohio.com 1968 Plymouth GTX Numbers matching All original sheetmetal 440 Super Commando, Four speed Highly detailed Copies of all original paperwork Plymouth's executive express--the GTX. The Road Runner's better looking and better equipped brother and the Fury's smaller cousin had both the looks and the power to carry you in comfort and tear up the quarter mile. You want to find one just like this, with all original, clean sheetmetal and the original 440 and four speed combo. Documents first. We have a binder full of photocopies of the original paperwork. Yes, this struck us as odd, as well, but we were told the originals were lost to theft. The original fender tag is in place, and there are so few options on the car that there simply isn't much to verify, anyway. Of the copies, we have the broadcast sheet, Certicard, bill of sale, window sticker and the fender tag. We also have the salesman's worksheet (buyer's proposal) he filled out with the customer, warranty information, and even a 1 cent PAL bubble gum wrapper that was left in the interior on assembly day in late 1967! Line workers were notorious for using new cars as trash cans, since cars built in this era were designed to last three to five years. Original owner Don Pankratz took delivery on January 3, 1968, from local dealer Southtown Chrysler-Plymouth in Bloomington, MN, nearly three months after ordering the car. The buyer's proposal shows he was thinking of trading his '63 Impala SS towards it, but the bill of sale shows an all-cash deal. Don wanted plain black wheels, but since cars with standard dog dish caps came equipped with body color wheels, the car shipped from St. Louis with deluxe, full wheel covers. We have copies of early photos of the car sans any cap, so it looks like the dealer kept the covers--there's no mention of them on the bill of sale. Under the hood is the original, highly detailed and numbers matching engine. Cooling dut R&H Collectibles is a private collection of fine automobiles including classic, muscle, custom hot rods and sports cars. All of our vehicles are kept in an secure, indoor, climate controlled facility. They are checked and maintained regularly to ensure they are in top condition. Others would have the glory of bolting the ultra-quick machines together, some would work in design and more yet would work for powertrain. So, why sales bank? They got to spec out 90% of the cars that rolled off the factory floor! If it wasn't ordered by a customer, you were responsible for filling dealership car lots. Imagine passing a car that YOU had influence over, with the satisfaction of a customer evident by the grin on their face! Here's a real beauty, done justice by the sales bank before shipping up north to Canada: Numbers matching engine and transmission Classic burnt orange and white paint scheme 440 Super Commando engine with 375hp 15 rallye wheels and BFGoodrich tires Brand new Moser Dana 60 axle Clean and straight bodywork Flowmaster rumble, big block torque! Burnt Orange is one of my favorite colors, especially on Chargers and GTX's. It's a classy hue, fitting the lines and missions of those cars. Yes, you can get a lime green or purple one, but that's ignoring the upscale mission of the GTX. Another reason to like it? If you've got one, and people ask you the color, you don't say Deep Burnt Orange Metallic. You say FK5, and Mopar people know EXACTLY what you mean. It's a color so cool, its initials alone speak for it! All by itself, FK5 can get a little heavy handed. That's what makes this car so special: There's plenty of white to balance out the rich color. White stripes, a white top and a white interior bring a balance so many muscle cars lack. Seller's Notes: Styled in homage to the wildly popular 1930s hi-boy hot rods, the Plymouth Prowler boasts styling unlike anything else on the road. With just 960 miles, example is one of, if not the lowest-mile Prowler available in the country. The previous owner was so enamored by this Prowler that he displayed it in his living room, only driving it for special occasions. It remains completely as ordered in Prowler Orange with leather seats, auto-dimming rear-view mirror, center-mounted instruments and an Autometer tach has been installed on the steering column. A stout 253hp 3.5L V6 powers this Plymouth through 17-inch chrome wheels and a black soft top with heated glass rear window hides neatly in the trunk when retracted. The original $45,000 window sticker is included along with the owners books, spare key, service records, CarFax and a 71-point. Prowlers are fast becoming a collectible commodity and this example, with the extremely low mileage and desirable features, looks to be a solid investment down the road.

Seller's Notes: 2 Owner/46,575 Original Miles!!Correct 383 Commando V8 w/ 4spdOriginal Red Interior, Spare, & Jack1 of 933 4 Speed Cars for ?65The Plymouth Satellite was part of the Belvedere line and was considered to be the top of the line. This Satellite was owned by the first owner until 2006 when it was passed on and later treated to an exterior restoration. When the car was painted, they retained the original color of Ruby Red and applied a new White Vinyl Roof and both are in like new condition! The original interior was detailed and reinstalled because of its near perfect condition. Being a Satellite, this car had more amenities than most, with options like the Bucket Seats, Full length console, AM Transaudio Radio, Padded Dash and Rear Arm Rest, Upgraded Seat Belts, Variable Speed Wipers with Washer, and the Light Group Package including Back-Up, Trunk, Parking Brake, and Glove Box lights.There were a few engine options available on the ?65 and the original owner chose wisely. This Satellite came with the 383 Commando V8 which put out 330 Horsepower and a whopping 425 lbs of Torque! Paired with the super rare 4 speed transmission and the 3:23 Super Grip rear end , this Satellite was a Wolf in Sheep?s clothing! All that power was spent through a true dual exhaust that was also brought back to factory specs.This Satellite truly drives like the day it was born in January of ?65. The optioned Suspension Package with Firm Ride Shocks keeps the car planted at speed but comfortable when cruising. The engine starts and runs effortlessly, until the secondary?s open up and the 425 lbs of torque roar to life! The transmission Shifts crisply and directly through all gears, thanks to the Hurst shifter.A thorough TLD service and inspection has just been performed to make sure that this car meets our strict standards. This Plymouth is one of the finest examples of a ?65 Satellite out there today. Don?t miss the opportunity to own a true piece For more information on the North Shores Finest cars, call 888-675-2358 or see www.thelastdetail.com

Seller's Notes: Mopar Cat Back Exhaust! White Top! Matching Trailer with Stand! Every Available Option! CARFAX 1 owner and buyback guarantee!!! Prowler Purple, chrome wheels, cd changer (wheels and changer were the only options), white top and stock black top, aftermarket grill, front bumpers removed, and aftermarket turn signals installed. We have the bumpers and OEM grill. A Mopar cat back exhaust has been installed, but we do not have the stock exhaust. The car will come with the factory Mopar trailer painted purple by Mopar, chrome wheels on the trailer, and the factory Mopar stand so the trailer can be stood up on its back end. The car had some scratches on the rear of the trailer and the right front fender has a small chip in it but all of them have been touched up. We have all the books and keys for both car and trailer. We have a full line of new and pre-owned vehicles to meet your needs always make sure you visit www.ringgoldcdj.com to view our complete inventory. Ringgold CDJ is a family owned and operated dealership for the last 2 generations and the owners office is right here at the dealership. If you have found what you need we do having shipping available for you please just ask your sale representative for more information. Ringgold Chrysler Dodge Jeep is happy to help you with all of your automotive needs. We have a no hassle no haggle policy and will work hard to find the right vehicle for you. Please call today at 888-698-8810

Seller's Notes: Here?s a limited production Plymouth Prowler for your consideration. The introduction of this sports car shocked the industry and its unique styling made this car a huge hit with Hot Rod enthusiasts. Less than 4,000 Prowlers were produced in 1999 and engine power increased up to 253HP. The car features a 3.5L H.O. V6 24V MPI engine mated to a 4-Speed Automatic with AutoStick sport shifting. All Prowlers came standard with chrome wheels and 4-Wheel Disc Brakes. Other features include A/C, 6-Disc CD player, power windows, leather seats, leather wrapped steering wheel, keyless entry, dual exhaust and much more. 

The Prowler will always be an iconic and highly desired vehicle. This car is 100% original, purchased new in 1999, with only 6K miles and comes with original window sticker. This Mopar remains in excellent mechanical condition and finished in the original Sherwood Green metallic paint that sets it farther apart. This is a reliable and quick cruiser that can be driven anywhere at anytime. It is a great car for the weekend car shows or a summer cruise to the local ice cream shop. 

The drivetrain features a 2003 360 (5.9L) Magnum (originally a 318) with all stock internals and converted holly carb. It has a March billet Serpentine belt drive, MSD Digital 6 ignition, MSD Pro-Billet Distributor, headers and dual 2.5-inch exhaust with H-pipe Summit Turbo mufflers, Built 904 with 9.5 inch PTC convertor, reverse manual valve-body and Hurst shifter, 8.75 rear with 355 Sure-Grip and Pinion Snubber, QA1 adjustable shocks, 12 gallon fuel cell with Holley Blue pump, .5-inch braided hose, and AN fittings provide plenty of fuel. This car starts up on demand and will run all day without the slightest hint of overheating. Performs like a late-model engine should with strong/quick torque. 

The body was repainted 20 years ago but still remains show-car worthy. It is equipped with a Hurst Pistol Grip Shifter plus a new OEM style ?Bumble Bee? stripe has been added as well as new paint under the hood, new door handles, black vinyl top recently refinished, new custom 15-inch wheels from Specialty Wheel painted body color with new Plymouth dog-dish caps, and new tires. The 430 gears still go with the cars to let it rip. The car has no rust throughout the body and the interior remains in nice original condition. It has a new Legendary front bench cover, original dash, and door panels/headliner remain in great shape. This is an awesome Mopar for the money ? you cannot recreate this car for the price offered here... Seller's Notes: Emmons Motor Company has found one of the few "survivors" from the Swingin' Sixties! As you drive our 1965 Plymouth Belvedere II sedan and accelerate the V8 engine in this time machine, you will travel back to the JFK days of big cars , men in slim fit suits, and beautiful women. The Belvedere II model was one of the the most popular 4-door sedans with 41,445 models produced that year. As you admire this piece of Detroit history, you too, will be pleasantly surprised at how intact and remarkably good condition the Belvedere badging and chrome trim has lasted all these years. The ORIGINAL Plymouth hubcaps show extremely well surrounded by the new Goodyear Allegra tires. The complete interior appears to be period correct. Whether you are a car collector or someone wanting a cruiser for weekend cars shows or cruise events with the family, this Belvedere II would be an excellent choice. ATTENTION CUSTOMERS!!! DO NOT go pay thousands more at any other dealership when this one is priced so competitively. Come take a look and you will not be disappointed! 
People are always asking us how it is that we have the lowest prices, when our vehicles are such high quality and guaranteed with a free vehicle history report. They are NOT branded titles, they do not have accidents. They are top notch quality, pre-owned vehicles that come with the Five Point Auto 7 day quality exchange promise. 
Well its time to reveal the secret, and there are NO gimmicks. We are a family run, locally owned dealership with over 25 years experience in selling autos. Unlike most other dealerships, we own all of our vehicles out right, and that means that we don't have to pay bank flooring costs, fees, or interest on our cars. Because of that, our overhead is low and we pass that savings on to you, our customer, in the extremely low prices that we offer with the vehicle that you want. 
So if you are in the market for a vehicle, before you go and pay thousands more, stop in and let us show you why so many people are switching to the FIVE POINT way of buying their vehicles. 
We are in Layton, UT off of I-15 exit 331. At the BOTTOM of the exit take a left and then take the very first right that you can take, which will be main street. This is the upgraded motor for the Neon not to be confused with the less than reliable SOHC 4cyl engine in lesser models. This car is in incredibly clean condition inside and out with no dings, dents, rust, or major scratches to be found on the body anywhere. The interior is super clean as well with no signs of major wear or abuse. The car has just been serviced and inspected in our service department including all new brakes and it also has a set of newer tires all around. If you are looking for a super clean sedan that will return incredible fuel economy and has been fully serviced and inspected, come check out this super clean Neon Highline. this Voyager doesn't have a stiff, bouncy truck-like ride. Getting in and out of the Voyager is one of the vehicle's best traits and an "Easy Out" roller rear seat makes it easier to modify the passenger/cargo layout to suit specific needs. With the rear seats out, there is enough room in the back to haul all sorts of camping equipment. 

Need more reasons to give our Voyager your serious consideration?? Dual sliding doors, rear side windows that open, tight turning radius and built in child seats with lots of window space.

Seller's Notes: This is a 1997 Plymouth Voyager Base Van with 140,034 miles. This van has a deep amethyst exterior with steel wheels and mist gray cloth interior. The Voyager is a very affordable seven passenger van. This Plymouth van comes equipped with power steering, tilt steering wheel, ABS brakes, driver and passenger airbags, am-fm stereo with a cassette player, and air conditioning. This van has a third row and still has a significant amount of trunk space. The Voyager has body damage on the passenger side along with rust on both sides of the vehicle. We have set the price well below KBB and NADA standards to give you the best possible deal out there! If you have any questions please contact Rob or Ryan @ 888-447-8039. We are happy to answer any questions you have! If you would like more pictures, further details or to schedule a test drive please contact Rob or Ryan @ 888-447-8039. Valley Auto Advisors is located in Aston, PA approximately 25 minutes from Center City Philadelphia. Selling Points: Bought van brand new. Served us well for 13 years, but time has come to say goodbye. Van had almost daily use. Long trips many times without issue. Has minor dings and scratches (see photos). Pretty good condition for its age. I did routine maintenance, changing oil and brake pads. Documented other maintenance I could not do myself (details upon request). Current tires have plenty of tread. Easy to remove rear seats. Can haul a good amount. Tried to be realistic but fair on price. If theres any info at all I can provide that will prevent you from wasting your time, Ill do whatever I can to help. Will only deal w/direct buyer (no dealers, no "relatives"). I sign over title w/price and insist you sign it at same time. I will hand over title upon receipt of check (allows you to get temp tags) but will keep van until check clears. Once you have temp tags, its all yours. (Sorry, been swindled B4.) 

Condition: I wish to be completely up front about all issues that may affect purchase decision. For other specific questions, please call. I will answer any question to avoid wasting your time. Power lock on the right sliding door does not work. Could be problem with actuator. For past two summers, I added about 3 cans of R134a coolant due to slow leak in the A/C system. That gets us through one Maryland summer. Coolant is under $20/can. $60/year cheaper than paying $1000 to get the leak fixed. (Please note that this is a detail I could easily have "neglected" to mention.) For questions or to arrange a test drive, please contact me (Jeff) at 2404012683 any time between the hours of 8 AM to 9 PM Eastern.

We are committed to redefining this experience, setting a higher standard, and changing the way people buy cars. Our goal is simple: Customers for life. This baby is a monster on the road. It has a LOUD set of duals on it that rumble and turn heads. The engine is beefed up with a nice hefty camshaft and a nice carb. The automatic transmission shifts very strong but is set up for drag racing where you pull it back to shift in reverse order 3=1 2=2 and 1=3. It has a nice set of alloy rims with a good set of rubber all the way around. It has a nice set of sunpro guages mounted under the dash. It is in very good shape and ready to hit the road or strip. The vehicle went through a recent restoration, it used to be red. We put it back to the color it was in the video and did some work on the interior. She is turn key, ready to go.
